Facsimile Images

τεῖδε Χοροὶ Κα[τ-]
ελὸς κεῖ<ν>ται θα[ν-]
άτοιο λαχόντε̣-
ς ἀνφοτέρος δ-
5ὲ καλὸς ͱυιὸς ἔ-
θαπσε φίλος

Apparatus criticus

Text of Pugliese Carratelli 1942

English translation

Here lie Choro and Katelos, having come to death. Both of them, in fine fashion, their beloved son has buried.

commentary
